comments.body: If they changed their name, is the path `/etc/SuSE-release` still valid? Did they ever change it to `/etc/SUSE-release`? If so, should we add that as an additional path here?
No, that path name was never changed, it has been replaced with /etc/os-release only.

comments.body: Since this is duplicated code, I wonder if it could be consolidated with the `Kali` branch.

I know that `platform.release()` is used for other BSDs, but I'm wondering if that is actually the expected value. I'm not a BSD user, but at least in the Linux world, I expected "release" to be a word, such as "trusty", or "stretch" rather than a version number.

Maybe it should be `GENERIC` as returned from `sysctl -n kern.version` rather than using the output of `platform.release()`?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +620,624 @@        netbsd_facts = {}
        platform_release = platform.release()
        netbsd_facts['distribution_release'] = platform_release
        rc, out, dummy = self.module.run_command("/sbin/sysctl -n kern.version")
        match = re.match(r'NetBSD\s(\d+)\.(\d+)\s\((GENERIC)\).*', out)

comments.body: Do you think we should add a backward compatible change for this fix? Also, please add a changelog entry and integration tests for this change? Thanks.

Please keep the mock data files and add `/etc/products.d/baseproduct` file content in `input` section.

Something like ...
```
   "input": {
        "/etc/SuSE-release": "SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 (x86_64)\nVERSION = 12\nPATCHLEVEL = 2\n# This file is deprecated and will be removed in a future service pack or release.\n# Please check /etc/os-release for details about this release.",
        "/etc/os-release": "NAME=\"SLES_SAP\"\nVERSION=\"12-SP2\"\nVERSION_ID=\"12.2\"\nPRETTY_NAME=\"SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP2\"\nID=\"sles_sap\"\nANSI_COLOR=\"0;32\"\nCPE_NAME=\"cpe:/o:suse:sles_sap:12:sp2\""
        "/etc/products.d/baseproduct": ...
    },
```
@Akasurde this wouldn't make sense, because we don't parse the `/etc/products.d/baseproduct`file content, we check the `/etc/products.d/baseproduct` symlink target name

diffHunk:

        # See https://www.suse.com/support/kb/doc/?id=000019341 for SLES for SAP
        if os.path.islink('/etc/products.d/baseproduct') and os.path.realpath('/etc/products.d/baseproduct').endswith('SLES_SAP.prod'):
            suse_facts['distribution'] = 'SLES_SAP'
